* City or town names (e.g., "New York," "Paris," "Tokyo")

To identify location entities in a text, you can look for proper nouns or descriptive phrases that refer to specific places or locations. It can also be helpful to use context clues to infer the location being referred to, even if it is not explicitly named in the text.
